'Oh my god, this means everything to me' - Aktins wins women's world freeski halfpipe gold
Great Britain's Zoe Atkin pulled off a stunning second run to take freeski halfpipe gold at the Freestyle Ski and Snowboard World Championships in Switzerland.
The 22-year-old American-born skier fell at the end of her opening attempt in Engadin but wowed the judges when the pressure was on to score 93.50.
She completed the set of medals at the worlds, following up on her silver and bronze at the two previous championships.
"Oh my god, this means everything to me," said Atkin, who beat China's Li Fanghui by just 0.5, while Canada's Cassie Sharpe claimed bronze with 88.00.
"After getting a third and a second, this season I was like 'you know what, I want to go for the gold'.
Read the full story here.
Who's in action today?
BBC Sport
Taking part in the freeski halfpipe women's final is current 2024-25 Freeski Halfpipe joint-Crystal Globe holder Zoe Atkin. Born in Massachusetts, USA, Atkin represents Great Britain professionally owing to her father being born in England. Atkin made her professional debut at the age of 14 and has gone on to win silver and bronze medals at the World Championships. The Brit made her Olympic debut at the 2022 winter games in Beijing, finishing in ninth place in the final.
Since, then Atkin has gone from strength to strength, winning gold and silver medals at the 2023 and 2024 X Games in the superpipe event.

Skiing

Snowboarding
